March 3, 1941
Mr. Prank E. Schooley, Executive Secretary
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
My dear Frank;
In going over a lot of material, I came across
your December report and the mention about an item of
December 4th in Variety.
I <3on*t know whether I told you of the cir¬
cumstances in connection with the item, but it was
actually the day before going to press that I discussed
the matter with Mr. Landry. The report was prepared
rather hastily and I am therefore sure I overlooked a
great deal of educational activities.
My point in writing is that sometime in Octo¬
ber or November, I thought a formal report of outstanding
activities should be submitted to Variety for their con¬
sideration in connection with their annual report.
With best regards,
MSNjsd
NEW YORK
WORLD'S FAIR 1940
'New York City's Own Station"—810 Kc.
